isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9800 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT

svcprocinfo.para: To assure correct clutch operation and long service life of clutch components, the clutch and the clutch control linkage must be properly adjusted.
Two types of adjustments must be made:
Adjustment factors are the release bearing to clutch brake clearance (clutch internal adjustment), the clutch pedal height and the release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance.

important.para: Do not change external (linkage) adjustments without first checking the clutch internal adjustment.

svcprocinfo.para: Changing the external adjustment will not compensate for an improperly adjusted clutch.
The following procedures cover only the external linkage adjustments.

note.para: Refer to the specific clutch section in GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for internal adjustment procedure.

svcprocinfo.para: Some clutches have a self-adjusting feature which automatically compensates for wear of clutch disc facings. However, initial settings must be established by manual adjustment at the time of clutch or clutch control linkage service.
To obtain proper clutch control operation, it is important that adjustment operations be performed in the following sequence:

item.para: Check clutch internal (release bearing) adjustment and readjust if necessary. Refer to the specific clutch section in GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Check clutch pedal adjustment and readjust if necessary. Refer to CLUTCH PEDAL
.

Check clutch release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance (clutch pedal free travel) and readjust if necessary. Refer to RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE
.

svcprocinfo.para: After all adjustments have been made, operate the clutch pedal to check clutch release and clutch brake operation. The clutch should fully release and the clutch brake should be applied before the clutch pedal contacts the cab insulator panel.

step1.para: Check the clutch pedal height ( Figure 2). If necessary, adjust the pedal return stop to obtain the maximum pedal height.

Check the upper (vertical) control rod adjustment. With the pedal fully returned against the pedal stop, the centerline of the lower yoke pin should align with the centerline of the cab pivot bolt ( Figure 3). If necessary, remove the yoke pin, loosen lock nut and adjust the yoke to obtain correct alignment.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. CENTERLINE OF YOKE PIN TO ALIGN WITH CENTERLINE OF CAB PIVOT BOLT

svcsubproc.title: RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) control rod adjusting yoke lock nut ( Figure 4).
Remove the cotter and yoke pins and disconnect the lower control rod from the release shaft lever.
Pull the release shaft lever forward until the release shaft yoke (fork) contacts the release bearing housing.

With the release shaft lever held forward (see Step 3), and the lower control rod held backward (clutch pedal against pedal stop), adjust the control rod yoke until the yoke pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and release shaft lever.
Remove the yoke pin and rotate the control rod yoke to lengthen control rod. Rotate yoke eight (8) turns on 1/2" (12.7 mm) diameter rod or seven (7) turns on 5/8" (15.9 mm) diameter rod.
Connect the control rod yoke to release shaft lever with the yoke pin. Tighten the adjusting yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.
This adjustment will provide the specified release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance ( Figure 4) and clutch pedal free travel ( Figure 5).

After all the adjustments have been made, operate the clutch pedal and check clutch release and clutch brake operation. The clutch should fully release and the clutch brake (where equipped) should be applied before the clutch pedal contacts the cab inner panel.
